struct.name: quiet_decoder_options
struct.doc:
This specifies a complete set of options for the decoder in libquiet.
In order for a decoder to decode the signals from an encoder, certain options must match between both. In particular, the encoding mode and modopt/demodopt must match. Additionally, if ofdm_encoding is used, then the ofdmopt must also match.

field.name: ofdmopt
field.brief: OFDM options, used only by OFDM mode

field.name: demodopt
field.brief: Decimation filter and carrier frequency options

field.name: resampler
field.brief: Resampler configuration (if specified frequency is not 44.1kHz)

field.name: encoding
field.brief: Encoder mode, one of {ofdm_encoding, modem_encoding, gmsk_encoding}

field.name: is_debug
field.doc:
Enable debug mode on receiver
In order for this flag to work, libquiet must be compiled in debug mode (#define QUIET_DEBUG 1). Once enabled, this mode causes the decoder to use liquid to create debug files which can be viewed in matlab/octave. These files have the filename format framesync_d, where d is an increasing number. These files can be useful for tracking the decoder's behavior.
